translation.title: Translation
translation.autoTranslateHint: Automatically translate feed posts and bios into your language

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.enableSoundsHint: Play sounds for door open/close, new messages, and incoming calls

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.ipProtectionHint: Direct connections to inner circle have low latency and a clear, snappy picture but expose your IP to the other caller. Relay hides your IP address but may add some latency.
privacy.directConnectionInfo: A direct connection is pure peer-to-peer. Your call goes straight to the other person with no server in between, which means low latency and a clear, snappy picture. The trade-off is that your IP address is visible to them. Think of your IP address like the front door of your house on the internet. Your inner circle should be people you'd trust with your physical address. If you'd be comfortable with that, direct connections are fine.
privacy.relayInfo: With relay, your call is routed through our server instead of going directly to the other person, so neither of you sees the other's IP address. This is technically not peer-to-peer, but we use it purely to hide your IP. Your call is still encrypted with DTLS-SRTP, meaning the encryption keys are negotiated directly between you and the other caller. Our relay server just forwards the packets and cannot see or hear anything.

options.nonInnerCircle: Direct for inner circle, relay for everyone else (recommended)
